newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Santos strike to continue until salary paid.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Santos strike to continue until salary paid.

text.p: Brazilian portworkers at public terminals in Santos port will only return to work when they have been given written confirmation the port authority has paid their full April salary, a union official said.
"The industrial action will continue until we are absolutely sure all the money has been paid," said a director from the local port operators' union.
Workers stopped work as of 0700 local/1000 GMT today because the CODESP port authority had only deposited 65 percent of the workers' April salary.
CODESP says its cash-flow problems are due to a four-day strike by stevedores in April.
A CODESP spokeswoman said the remaining 35 percent was expected to be deposited today but the union director said he had been told the money would only be transfered on Friday.

Union members are to protest outside the CODESP building at 1700 local/2000 GMT today but should workers receive confirmation today the money is in the bank, they would return to work immediately, he added.
Some 10 ships in public terminals at the port have been hit by the stoppage, a port spokeswoman said earlier today.
These include a soybean vessel and two wheat ships.
Santos is also Brazil's key coffee loading port, accounting for just under one million bags of the 1.2 million bags covered so far by bills of lading for April shipment.
Given that coffee is loaded in containers, the port authority did not have details of how much coffee may have been hit by the stoppage.
Private terminals have not been affected. ((-Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151))
